name: RuneFest
description:
The RuneFest app is the essential companion for everyone going to RuneFest 2018, which takes place on October 5th and October 6th at the Farnborough International Exhibition and Conference Centre.

The RuneFest app will not only tell you precisely where and when every RuneFest session takes place, but its map and personal schedule features will alert you when a session is about to begin, and then show you the way there! You can even tell it exactly how much notice you want before each event, and a custom alert will ensure you don’t miss a single minute.

Hungry or thirsty? No problem – the app will point you in the direction of refreshments. Need to sit out a session? Sure – the app will let you check out the livestream instead.

The RuneFest app in the very best way to make the most of the greatest RuneScape event in the world. We can’t wait to see you all there!

Features include:
• Complete and updated event schedules
• Map with locations and directions to every event
• Personalised schedules – decide what you want to be reminded about and how far in advance
• Live polling during panel sessions and Q&A’s
• Event update notifications straight to your smartphone
• Directions to food and drink kiosks
• Links to the RuneFest Twitch livestream of every single session
• Merchandise store listings
• Online ticket store
• Golden Gnome nominations & voting
• Access to all official social media channels
• Comprehensive event information and FAQ

N.B. Performance of this app may vary according to the age of the device and the number of applications open on it. This app will work over 3G, 4G or Wi-Fi although we recommend a Wi-Fi connection for the best experience.

To find out more about RuneFest and buy tickets please visit
https://www.runefest.com/

We require all RuneFest attendees to have valid photo ID which matches the information on their ticket. Valid ID includes passports, driving licenses, military ID, identity cards, age verification cards with a valid hologram. Event attendees must be aged 16 or over, or otherwise be accompanied by a parent or guardian over the age of 18.
